profileAlternative.headline: Nexus of Technology and Communications
profileAlternative.summary:
Systems Architect and Project Lead with end-to-end understanding of internet technologies. Strong interest in user interaction, informed by studies in anthropology and linguistics. Specialist in communication, especially cross-team facilitation. Interested in running ventures applying a strict scientific approach to product design to elevate the field from "user-friendly design" to "society-friendly design".

Specialties: Tech: TCP/IP and common application protocols, Unix sysadmin, MacOS expert, Java, C++, Ruby, all DHTML components.
Product: good design, team leadership, inter-team coordination
Agile methodology and modern programming paradigms
Lateral thinking
Gestalt understanding of business process, design, and technology
Strong understanding of UX and design principles
Social Media expertise

positions.description:
As senior advisor on matters of communication to the CTO:

* Speechwriter for formal appearances
* Blogging and social media
* Editor in Chief of the engineering team's technical blog, The MongoDB Engineering Journal
* Proxy to internal communications teams.

positions.title: Principal
positions.description: Expertise at the intersection of technology, product formulation, and business strategy.

positions.title: ShopWiki
positions.description:
Responsible for leadership of development team, QA teams, choices of particular technologies, operations infrastructure, and application architecture. Participated in product formulation, strategic decision-making, and held final authority over site behavior.

Member of three person Steering Committee making all strategic decisions.
Founded an application QA team and hired QA staff to build an automated testing suite using Hudson for continuous integration, and Selenium for front-end testing.
Designed a ground-up migration of the ShopWiki UI onto a new platform of Apache, Django, and MongoDB.
Architected global image thumb-nailing and caching for ShopWiki's 250MM product images.
Evolved the application development cycle into 2 week sprints, with automated testing (functional, unit, and pre-deploy performance testing), and automated rollouts with easy rollback.
Oversaw  the development of a data feed consuming system for multiple affiliate networks.
Represented ShopWiki IT in diligence meetings with potential acquiring companies, crafting and presenting a comprehensive presentation of all of ShopWiki's technology
Post-acquisition, ran integration efforts of ShopWiki with Oversee, in operations and development

given.text: Avery's an outstanding manager and tech lead. He's a hands-on software developer, a brainstormer, a mentor. When I worked with him at ShopWiki I saw him combine statistics, business goals, and input from managers and developers to plan new strategies for the firm's future.

Since Avery's departure from DoubleClick, I think I've tried to hire him back to work with me 7 or 8 different times. Avery is possibly the best hire I've ever made. He is extremely intelligent, technically sophisticated, and is one of the most fun and interesting people I've had the pleasure of working with. If you ever get him to work with you, please tell me how you did it, so someday I can get him back to working with me!

received.text:
David Shadpour is an expert in online marketing and business development. As a former DoubleClick employee, I know when someone understands online marketing, and when I met David, I could tell right away that he knew he was on the ball. 

He's smart, personable, reliable, and mater-of-fact. His years of experience lend him a savviness that is an asset to any business looking to reach a market, build a brand, or refine a strategy. David is serious about performance-based marketing efforts and understands the crucial role of analytics and hard data.

Renee is a diligent team member who brings positivity and good spirit to her surroundings. With both a creative eye and a head for technical detail, you can trust her to take a task or manage a project to completion.
